Package fr.rphstudio.codingdojo.game.functions

This documentation gathers all the function information you need in order to write your ship AI program.
Each function has a complete description of its purpose, input parameters and output value. Sometimes, some schematics are added for a better understanding.
These functions are dispatched in several groups :
  • DISPLAY : everything you need to customize your ship appearance is located here.
  • GLOBAL : All the race information are here (number of laps, race position, number of ships attending, number of checkpoints, ...)
  • STATUS : this is the place where you will find all the meters of your ship (speed, position, ...)
  • ACTION : the best place if you need to perform any action on your ship (moving, turning, ...)
  • CHECKPOINTS : all the checkpoint information are located here (position, charging ability, ...)
  • TRIGONOMETRY : if you're not a nerd, no problem : we provide you some functions to compute for you
Good Luck Coders !!
Version:
v2.1.x
Author:
Romuald GRIGNON
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CheckPoints
    CHECKPOINT FUNCTIONS
    This module gathers all the checkpoint information (position, charging ability) but also some information for beginners like the next checkpoint position or the first charging checkpoint position.
    Display
    DISPLAY FUNCTIONS
    This module gathers all functions that are used to modify the appearance of the ship.
    Global
    GLOBAL FUNCTIONS
    This module contains all the information about the progress of all ships attending the race.
    ShipActions
    ACTION FUNCTIONS
    This module gathers all functions needed to make the player ship move.
    ShipStatus
    STATUS FUNCTIONS
    This module gathers all functions needed to get information about the ship movements.
    Trigonometry
    TRIGONOMETRY FUNCTIONS
    This module contains all the trigonometry functions you need to perform angle and distance computation.
    In the spaceship environment, we will manipulate angles in degrees.
